newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Supreme Court hears arguments in Clinton case.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Supreme Court hears arguments in Clinton case.

text.p: The Supreme Court on Monday began hearing arguments on whether a sexual harrassment lawsuit against President Bill Clinton should be deferred until after he has left office.

The court was not considering the merits of the suit, filed by former Arkansas state employee Paula Jones, but was reviewing the important constitutional issue of whether sitting U.S. presidents are immune from civil suits involving private conduct. Clinton wants the suit deferred until he leaves office while Jones wants it to proceed.
